articles.title: Floral Basket Presented to DPRK Embassy in Equatorial Guinea
U.S. Plan to Use Nukes against DPRK Disclosed
articles.content:
Floral Basket Presented to DPRK Embassy in Equatorial Guinea 
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo who is the founder and chairman of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Malabo on Feb. 16, congratulating leader Kim Jong Il on his birthday.
 The delegation of the party paid a congratulatory visit to the embassy to lay a floral basket before his portrait and pay tribute to him.    
 The head of the delegation referred to the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and peoples. He wholeheartedly wished the fraternal Korean people greater success in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and achieve the peaceful reunification of Korea under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Peasants and Moviemen of S. Korea Stage Joint Action against Conclusion of FTA
articles.content:
U.S. Plan to Use Nukes against DPRK Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that the U.S. had a plan to use nukes against the DPRK in 1975, according to the KBS of south Korea.
 This was disclosed by a confidential document of the Command of the U.S. Forces in the Pacific.    
 The document confirmed the fact that missile and artillery batteries of the U.S. forces equipped with nukes were stationed in south Korea in 1975 and there was the possibility of their use of nukes as deterrent to beat back "invasion by the north". It was also mentioned in the document that the then U.S. secretary of Defense directly referred to the tactical use of nukes on the Korean Peninsula, in particular.

Greetings to Sultan of Brunei Darussalam
Greetings to FM of Brunei Darussalam
articles.content:
Greetings to Sultan of Brunei Darussalam
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to head of state Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, sultan of Brunei Darussalam, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from British Ambassador
articles.content:
Greetings to FM of Brunei Darussalam
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his counterpart of Brunei Darussalam Mohamad Bolkiah.
 Extending warm congratulations to him on the occasion of the national day of Brunei Darussalam, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Guyana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from British Ambassador
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from British Ambassador to the DPRK John Everard at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and officials of the British embassy.
 Kim Yong Nam conversed with the ambassador after receiving his credentials.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Philippine President
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guyana
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Feb. 20 sent a message of greetings to President of the Cooperative Republic of Guyana Bharrat Jagdeo on the occasion of the 36th anniversary of the proclamation of the republic.
 The message wished him bigger success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and the promotion of the wellbeing of its people.    
  It expressed the expectation and belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Rim Hyong Won
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Philippine President
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today  sent a message of sympathy to Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, president of Philippines, in connection with an landslide that hit Leyte Island, the central part of the country, causing big casualties and material damage.
 The message expressed deep sympathy to the victims and the bereaved families and the people in the afflicted area.    
 It also expressed the belief that the president and the government of Philippines would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disaster and bring people's living to normal as early as possible.
